Reviews.Title: “Beware! Upon arriving at hotel I was met by security and what I thought would help, ended up costing big bucks”
Reviews.Author: KClevenger71
Reviews.Content: The security guard on patrol approached me as I arrived and told me that if I throw him a few dollars he will watch my truck. I explained that my company does not repay us for something like that. 2 days later truck was broke into .ransacking interior. Took gps and iPod touch (both under seat) and took chargers, aux cables,. When I talked to general manager he told me that was 3rd time he heard same shakedown. How many guests have to be vandalized before you change security companys and protect your guest? I was disgusted at hotels lack of concern for guest . Will NEVER stay there again, and rooms were out dated

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Hareliko
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in room 140. which is very close to the back entrance, So I was very close to my car. Breakfast is nice with good variety. Hotel is clean and quite. It is fairly close to downtown Dallas, and I think the hotel offers shuttle services. Staff was nice and welcoming

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmhaugland
Reviews.Content: Our family( three of us) stayed here for one night while we were in town for a Mavericks basketball game. We chose it due to its convenient location for the game. It's not within walking distance to the American Airlines Center, but a very easy mile or so drive from there. The beds were comfortable, the rooms clean, and the staff very friendly. The lady at the desk, Tiffany, was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions for the area. The breakfast was just right for us, the man taking care of the breakfast area was friendly and kept it well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and location.”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick trip into Dallas. They are connected with the Courtyard here and trade the benefits of both hotels. Nice pool and patio area here and fitness area. The staff were helpful in suggesting where to eat and answer questions.

Reviews.Title: “the best sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: RalucaCruceru
Reviews.Content: I've traveled through almost all Europe and starting this summer, I can say a part of the US, too. YET, this hotel had the BEST BED I HAVE EVER SLEPT IN! It was really heaven like, big, comfy, fluffy, so soft... can't describe it fully. ALL I wanted after my trips all aroud Dallas cuty and Forth Worth:) More than friendly staff, great help (they even put me some postcards I forgot about to post the morning I left Dallas- which I Thank them very much), great pancakes;) and good breakfast:)

Reviews.Title: “Unable to follow my Mother's advice: "don't let the bed bugs bite"”
Reviews.Author: canuckfromflorida
Reviews.Content: This was a typical Fairfield Inn. Only problem - - next day, my arms were coated in bites. Now one week later, they are still itching, oozing. I think some of these bites will leave scars. Have visited the doctor.....trying cortizone cream My own conclusion: i) Allergic reaction to the sheets - due to chemicals/soaps used to launder sheets. This is unlikely, as there seems to be "bite patterns" on arms ii) Scabies. If the bedsheets were not (properly) cleaned, scabies can remain on the sheets from a previous guest iii) Bed bugs. This is the most likely. Upon researching hotels in the Dallas market center area, it seems that many properties have had bed bug outbreaks over the past several years, including the neighboring Courtyard. Advice - if you stay here, INSPECT mattress and if possible - behind headboard - very carefully. Just a couple of bedbugs can do a whole lot of biting......

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, missing some things other Fairfields have”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastgirlforever
Reviews.Content: Front desk was excellent. Parking lot a little funky to get into. Went to Courtyard in error. Courtyard is more prominent when pulling in lot, had to go to the back for Fairfield. One small entrance. Bathroom is one with sink outside toilet/tub area so if you like that, this will work for you. Room ok, we were so tired as long as we could sleep. Didn't have a freezer we could put blue ice packs in overnight for early departure which is helpful when driving 15 hour days to keep sodas and food fresh. Overall ok, staff nice, quiet sleep once we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller hotel, but all you need if you'll be out & about town.”
Reviews.Author: fabulous990
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. Front desk staff are very friendly & outgoing. Gave me great recommendations for dinner options. Free wireless, continental breakfast included in room cost. Courtyard Marriott right next door with a small restaurant & bar. Overall good experience & would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: Neko786
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed at â€“ and I didnâ€™t even spend the night! My friend and I arrived at 2:00PM from the airport knowing very well that the check-in was not until 3:00PM. The hotel was buzzing because there was a cheerleader competition in town. When we arrived, the gentleman at the front desk informed us in a very rude manner that the rooms were not ready stating â€œand check-in is actually until 3:00PM.â€� Though we felt this comment was unnecessary, we shook it off, asked them to store our luggage, and were informed of a good restaurant where we could walk to get something to eat. When we returned a little after 3:00, we were informed that only one of the rooms was ready. The room was in the WORST location of the hotel â€“ in front of their indoor swimming pool on their first floor. I could only imagine the screams I would be hearing from the cheerleaders later on that day. About 30 minutes later my friend decided that he better stop by the front desk to check to see if his room was ready. By this time, the front desk had changed shifts and there were two girls there. A few minutes later I got a call from him asking me to stop by because they were relocating him to the hotel next door. Apparently the hotel was undergoing a renovation and they were not going to be able to provide a room for him. One of the girls was very understanding of the fact that we wanted to stay close together, but I cannot say the same for the other girl. She was literally scowling at the fact that we were asking if they could move both rooms. How was this not more of an inconvenience to her guest who had already unpacked most of her stuff? The whole issue could have been avoided if they would have just told us when we arrived. In the end, my friend ended up getting upset and it was only after this that she agreed to change both of our rooms. She, however, never apologized for her attitude. If I had to recommend something from this hotel it would be â€“ stay next door! The Courtyard by Marriott was in MUCH better condition. Unfortunately, they are owned by the same company, so they share front office staff. Our â€œfriendâ€� at the desk was ready to meet us with her scowl once we moved over. I am a very easy person to please, but there were just too many things wrong with this stay â€“ and I didnâ€™t even get to experience the loud noise from the pool! I hope very much that management find ways to correct these problems. Why spend so much money on a renovation when the front office staff is not properly trained in guest service? They should visit the Embassy Suites Near the Galleria. Now THAT is a hotel who properly trains their staff to be courteous to ALL guests.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Peppurrr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this Inn. The beds were the best I have encountered at any hotel. Our third story room had a wonderful view of downtown Dallas. It was very clean and the folks at the check in counter were helpful and friendly. The breakfast offered was marvelous. All in all a great experience. We know where we will stay on our next trip to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Right price”
Reviews.Author: Robsgirl637
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while attending the Texas State Fair in Dallas. The hotel is pretty much what we expected....the hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, and the price was right for the accomidations we received. The area is a little scary, as it is located in a pretty industrial area, so be aware of that when you book. Overall, even though the hotel was nice and comfortable, it was far off the beaten path, and we would probably stay at a higher end hotel. The Fairfield line from Marriott could be described as their cheap properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, 5 minutes to downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: firetiger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is across I35 from Word Trade Center and 2 minutes from American Airlines Center. Only 7 minutes to Pearl street in Downtown Dallas. Hotel was very clean. The best Continental Breakfast I have ever had. Had hot scrambled eggs, very nice eating area. Fully stocked ! Hotel seemed to be built in the last few years, one block off of I35 on Market Center. Price seems to be $85 per night firm at all times. Bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Room was nice. FREE WIFI, nice work area. Very pleased with hotel,service and price was excellent for area. If you need to stay close to downtown Dallas this place is a great value and comfortable stay. Indoor and outdoor pools

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cairngrassie
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel. Only had one night here but got to tell you, I had a fantastic sleep here. Very comfortable bed indeed. This small hotel doesn't have a dining lounge as such, but that's not a problem in USA there;s a Denny's right next door also bigger hotel next door too. Small swimming pool looked okay but I didn't actually use it. Free internet PC in foyer was handy to have. For a 2 Star hotel it's good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean affordable room”
Reviews.Author: smudad
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous. I arrived before check-in to pick up my key and the desk person said that while the room wasn't ready, but that I could put my luggage in the room and she would have housekeeping get right on the room, however, it wasn't necessary, because I wouldn't be returning until after midnight. When I did arrive at that hour I did notice there was security patrolling the parking lot, which I also did on subsequent evenings. When I arrived I asked a maintenance man if he could point me in the right direction, and he said he would show me, which he did. The hotel was clean and the rooms were good size. There was not a charge for the wireless internet nor did they charge a parking fee which some of the hotels in the area do. They also have a continental breakfast which was staffed and replenished; it consisted of oatmeal, waffles, fruit, pastries, yogurt, coffee and juices. There are tables available to sit. While definitely not a destination resort, it is a well maintained property at a reasonable and afordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: jcarolg
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed at this place when my husband was in the Baylor Rehab Hospital. They offered a Baylor discount and it made the stay alot more reasonably priced compared to others in the area of the hospital. The kids and I really enjoyed the indoor swimming pool to relax with in the evenings after a long day at the hospital. I would stay here again if the opportunity ever comes again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay; great bed!”
Reviews.Author: blonde12
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield is a nice budget hotel, and the new bedding is extremely comfortable! I needed to be in the Market Center area very early one morning, and since it was just a quick business trip, I didn't want to spend a lot on a room. This part of Dallas isn't the greatest, but I was pleased with Fairfield's security and cleanliness. My only complaint was the musty, strange smell in my room. Once I ran the a/c for awhile, the smell dissipated (or I got used to it). Based upon my experiences with other hotels in the area, I was thrilled to have such a comfortable bed, a clean room, and a quiet a/c. The available breakfast was a pleasant surprise. Based upon other reviews I had expected limited choices, and was pleased to see cereals, bagels, boiled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, waffles, fruit, etc. Should I ever have a similar short trip to this part of town, I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoWanders
Reviews.Content: I was not hopeful when I walked into the lobby of this hotel, but my experience was really quite positive. The staff were very friendly and I was greeted with warm cookies. The one-bedroom suite I was given was very nice. The bathroom was dark and small, but the rooms themselves were great. I had a nice stereo, couch, desk, bed (with clean and beautiful linens), etc... The room was great - especially for the price I paid. The hotel was centrally located and had a beautiful outdoor courtyard that is shared with the Marriott Courtyard next door. There is an indoor and outdoor pool, hot tub, patio, etc... I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler74
Reviews.Content: Whereas this wasn't the best Fairfield by Marriott I've stayed at, it wasn't bad, and lived up to the expectations of the name. The staff was friendly, the continental breakfast was very good, and they were able to accomodate my request for a refrigerator. My only complaint is that the guest who previously occupied my room *hid* garbage underneath the nightstand where the maid couldn't see it. I only saw it because I moved the nightstand to plug something in. I would make 2 requests--To travelers: Don't hide your garbage where the maid can't find it. To chambermaids: Please move furniture to look for garbage. Notwithstanding, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Courtyard right next to the hotel a bit better”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: Having the Courtyard Marriott right next to the Fairfield Inn causes a bad case of comparison! The price was right for this hotel (stayed two nights) instead of the Coutyard Marriott. Denny's right next door if you don't want the breakfast (pretty slim picking but not that bad). Nice pool but seems like it is in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad if you don't mind al little noise”
Reviews.Author: Caraib321
Reviews.Content: Sure the rooms are clean, but walls and floors must be paper thin. Stay top floor to avoid noise. Of course, Fairfield Inn cheaper and lower on the totem pole than other Marriott hotels. Not all that bad for the money, unless you need to go to sleep early.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was good size, but decor and furniture below average. Bedding had stains on sheets, however rest of room appeared clean. Loud heating and a/c system. Not impressed. Area is not great, but there are several other hotels right in general area that might be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the pice”
Reviews.Author: gulig
Reviews.Content: It is a Fairfield, no more no less. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The service was very helpfull and friendly. They have a small indoor pool, an an excersize room in the courtyard a few yards away. The complementary breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “sleep peacefully for 12hrs.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was with some friends over the Superbowl weekend and we had a wonderful time. With all due to respect the clerk at the time was a helpful little lady. I didn't get the name but she made maps for us to go place to have fun and shop. We arrived around 12:30 or 1:00 pm sat. 1/31. I would like to think your business for being so kind and friendly. Hope to be back real soon. "How about those Cowboys?"

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn Dallas Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2110 Market Center Boulevard, at Stemmons, Dallas, TX 75207
